382180: Caves of Koilos.author: DarthParallax
382180: Caves of Koilos.text_parsed:
Alright, time to get into the WABAC machine---


Way, Way, WAY BAC-- around 1995 or so? Magic's second expansion, Antiquities, focused on the Brother's War, a time *before the very COLORS OF MAGIC* had been discovered yet. A time when Dominaria was just beginning to learn the name "Urza", -before- he was Urza Planeswalker.
A Time AEONS after the long-forgotten race of the Thran buried and locked away the menace of Phyrexia and its dark master Yawgmoth. The world was different then.


"Koilos" is the name of the cave where the Gateway to Phyrexia was first discovered by Mishra, Artificer Prodigy and his brother Urza, working as Argivian Archaelologists to uncover the secret history of the Thran and their fabled Powerstones
382180: Caves of Koilos.text_posted:
Alright, time to get into the WABAC machine--- 


Way, Way, WAY BAC-- around 1995 or so? Magic's second expansion, [i]Antiquities[/i], focused on the Brother's War, a time [b]*before the very COLORS OF MAGIC* had been discovered yet.[/b] A time when Dominaria was just beginning to learn the name "Urza", -before- he was Urza Planeswalker. 
A Time AEONS after the long-forgotten race of the Thran buried and locked away the menace of Phyrexia and its dark master Yawgmoth. The world was different then. 


"Koilos" is the name of the cave where the [autocard]Gateway to Phyrexia[/autocard] was first discovered by [autocard]Mishra, Artificer Prodigy[/autocard] and his brother Urza, working as [autocard]Argivian[/autocard] Archaelologists to uncover the secret history of the [autocard]Thran[/autocard] and their fabled [autocard]Powerstone[/autocard]s

382181: City of Brass.author: DaLucaray
382181: City of Brass.text_parsed: What with this reprint and Mana Confluence, I can see this city's price dropping soon.
382181: City of Brass.text_posted: What with this reprint and [autocard]Mana Confluence[/autocard], I can see this city's price dropping soon.

382181: City of Brass.author: SquadronDemon
382181: City of Brass.text_parsed: It seems very strange to me that this was included over Godless Shrine.
382181: City of Brass.text_posted: It seems very strange to me that this was included over Godless Shrine.

382181: City of Brass.author: Lazrbeams
382181: City of Brass.text_parsed: Why is this in a 2 color deck? Should have been marsh flats
382181: City of Brass.text_posted: Why is this in a 2 color deck? Should have been [autocard]marsh flats[/autocard]

382181: City of Brass.author: Mode
382181: City of Brass.text_parsed:
I like the fact that we got a reprint with this. It would have been nice to get 7th Edition's artwork on black border in a modern frame. But Modern Masters' artwork, although (obviously) already available like that, is still great.

But in regard of its function in the Event Deck, putting this in two color deck is just ridiculous.


This would have been the perfect opportunity to reprint Marsh Flats. Were they afraid this deck wouldn't get into the hands of new players that plan on getting into Modern if they would have included fetchies instead?

True, the retail price of 75$ covering two fetchies, a Sword of Feast and Famine and Elspeth, Knight-Errant would have made this a good deal with 56 other decent cards as a free gift, so this could indeed have happened.
So they maybe would have been forced to adjust the price further up in an attempt to not step on any collector's toes by messing with the secondary market, and didn't want to do that.

But still, come on.      The prices of fetchlands are so bloated. It won't hurt to bring more of them into circulation.

And if the price of fetchies drop, the price of your average Modern deck drops significantly as well.
And with that, the appeal for new players to start playing Modern increases.

Don't be shy Wizards, just reprint those fetchlands already!
(The original, even more bloated, original, ally-colored cycle from Onslaught included.)
M15 Fetchies. Make it happen.

Don't be shy Wizards, just reprint those fetchlands already!
(The original, even more bloated, original, ally-colored cycle from Onslaught included.)
M15 Fetchies. Make it happen.

382182: Dismember.author: DaLucaray
382182: Dismember.text_parsed: This is absolutely prime removal. Four life to take down, say, a 6/5? Totally worth it. If your life is only 3 though you can still play it safe.
382182: Dismember.text_posted: This is absolutely prime removal. Four life to take down, say, a 6/5? Totally worth it. If your life is only 3 though you can still play it safe.

382182: Dismember.author: Kor_Sanctifier
382182: Dismember.text_parsed: Even without the Phyrexian mana option, this would be a decent card. With the ability to play this in a nonblack deck, for one mana? It's a GREAT card, and I'm glad it got a reprint.
382182: Dismember.text_posted: Even without the Phyrexian mana option, this would be a decent card. With the ability to play this in a nonblack deck, for one mana? It's a GREAT card, and I'm glad it got a reprint.

382182: Dismember.author: Heinekant
382182: Dismember.text_parsed: As far as black goes, better removal spells exist.  This card's versatility is what makes it an all-star.  4/5
382182: Dismember.text_posted: As far as black goes, better removal spells exist.  This card's versatility is what makes it an all-star.  4/5

382182: Dismember.author: KFrosty

What I think is funny about this card is that there are so many cards out there that can survive being dismembered.

"What do you mean that Terastodon is destroying my creatures? I ripped his legs off 2 turns ago!"

What I think is funny about this card is that there are so many cards out there that can survive being dismembered.

382186: Honor of the Pure.author: DaLucaray
382186: Honor of the Pure.text_parsed: Recently, on a challenge, I made a casual mono-white deck. It's filled to the brim with anthems, and did very, very well. The difference between two 1/1 soldiers and two 2/2 soldiers is the difference of the game, let me tell you.

382192: Path to Exile.author: DaLucaray
382192: Path to Exile.text_parsed: Now this spell raises good questions. Is removing this creature worth the tempo lost by you? Would I rather my opponent be able to play a four drop or have a Tarmogoyf? I'm not good enough to say. Cards like these can show just how good a magic player you are. I love those kinds of cards.

382200: Sword of Feast and Famine.author: DaLucaray
382200: Sword of Feast and Famine.text_parsed: One of the better swords, keeping up card advantage and giving protection from doom blade and Tarmogoyf. The untap land part is a little funny, but it works great with combat tricks. Remember kids, use you second main phase!

382201: Tidehollow Sculler.author: A3Kitsune
382201: Tidehollow Sculler.text_parsed: Quite often, delaying a play is just as effective as preventing it completely.
382201: Tidehollow Sculler.text_posted: Quite often, delaying a play is just as effective as preventing it completely.

382202: Vault of the Archangel.author: DaLucaray
382202: Vault of the Archangel.text_parsed: The deathtouch/lifelink combination of abilities (This, Basilisk Collar, Vampire Nighthawk...) are the exact opposite of winmore. They do nothing if you're winning, but if you're losing they cushion your life total and help your board. While they have no interesting interactions, they still make a powerful and fun pair. Plus, you know, life/death.
382202: Vault of the Archangel.text_posted: The deathtouch/lifelink combination of abilities (This, Basilisk Collar, Vampire Nighthawk...) are the exact opposite of winmore. They do nothing if you're winning, but if you're losing they cushion your life total and help your board. While they have no interesting interactions, they still make a powerful and fun pair. Plus, you know, life/death.

382202: Vault of the Archangel.author: Kor_Sanctifier
382202: Vault of the Archangel.text_parsed: While this card is on the apex of 'win more', I have to disagree with DaLucaray a bit. Deathtouch is always useful in any point in the game, and if you need to get that last kill through in your enemy's defenses, it's a great thing to have. Lifelink is not as central in helping you win, but it'll give you a bit of assurance during a final alpha strike. Of course, this card is also good on the defense, where your chump block becomes a kill spell and your bigger guy becomes a cushion to anything that could get through. 4/5 to me.
382202: Vault of the Archangel.text_posted: While this card is on the apex of 'win more', I have to disagree with DaLucaray a bit. Deathtouch is always useful in any point in the game, and if you need to get that last kill through in your enemy's defenses, it's a great thing to have. Lifelink is not as central in helping you win, but it'll give you a bit of assurance during a final alpha strike. Of course, this card is also good on the defense, where your chump block becomes a kill spell and your bigger guy becomes a cushion to anything that could get through. 4/5 to me.

382204: Zealous Persecution.text_posted: Two mana to completely change the tide of a battle. I'd say that's worth it.
